div.head: THE EGYPTIAN GAZETTE
No. 7,134] ALEXANDRIA, MONDAY, FEBURARY 27, 1905. [SIX PAGES P.T. 1.
The Eastern Telegraph Company, Limited.
div.p:
This Company's system of submarine telegraph
cables is the most direct and quickest means of
communication from Egypt to Europe, North and
South America, East, South and West Africa,
India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan.

To secure quick transmission, telegrams should
be marked Via Eastern.

For latest average time to London, see daily
bulletin in this paper.

STATIONS IN EGYPT: Alexandria, Cairo,
Suez, Port-Tewfik, Port-Saïd, Suakin. Head
Office. London.

div.head: Orient-Pacific Line of Royal Mail Steamers.
div.p: OUTWARDS to AUSTRALIA.
R.M.S. “Orhir" will leave Suez about March 10
R.M.S "Orotava" will leave Suez about March 24.
HOMEWARDS to NAPLES MARSEILLES, GIBRALTAR, PLYMOUTH, LONDON, TILBURY
R.M.S. "Oroya" will leave Port Said about Feburary 27
R.M.S. “Ormus" will leave Port Said about March 18
N,B,--Homeward steamers are sometimes before their advertised dates
Passengers landed and embarked at Ismailia, Quarantins Regulations permitting,
free of all expense.

Return tickets no longer issued, but passengers paying full fare in one direction are allowed abatement of 1/3 fare back if return voyage be within 4 months of arrival, or abatement of 20 o/o if return voyage be made within 8 months of arrival.
Agents. Cairo:—Thos. Cook & Son. Alexandria : —R. J. Moss & Co.—For all information apply so
Wm. STAPLEDON & Sons, PORT-SAID & PORT-TEWFIK (Suez) 31-12-904

div.head: BIBBY LINE MAIL STEAMERS.
div.p: Special Reduced Rates During Summer Season,
OUTWARDS to COLOMBO, TUTICORIN, etc., and RANGOON.
S.S. Worcestershire 7,160 tons, leaves Suez about March 2.
S.S. Warwickshire 7,966 tons, leaves Suez about March 16.
HOMEWARDS to MARSEILLES and LONDON.
S.S. Lancashire 4,214 tons, leaves Port-Said about March 6.
S.S. Shropshire 6,220 tons leaves Port-Said about March 20.
FARES from Port Said to Marseilles £12.0.0, London £17.0.0, Colombo £32.10.0, Rangoon £37.10.0.
Fixed with Refrigerators, Electric Lights, Electric fans and all recent improvements.
Agents Cairo: THOS. COOK & SON. Suez & Port Said : WM. STAPLEDON & SONS,
NOTE-The outward Bibby will henceforth leave Suez one day later than before.

div.head: KHEDIVIAL MAIL LINE.
div.p: Express Steamers leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIRAEUS, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London.

Fast steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 6 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazareth), BEYROUT (for Damascus), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate weeks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus).
Steamers leave Suez every Thursday at 6 p.m. for JEDDAH, sailing as required at TOR(for Morde and Yahht) and/accounting is nineteen weeks as MUAKIM,MASSOWAH, HODBIDAH, and ADEN
N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free.
Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company’s Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at THOS. COOK & SON or other Tourist Agency.

div.head: The Moss S.S. Company, Ltd.
div.p: For LIVERPOOL calling at MALTA (Messrs. JAMES MOSS & Co. 31, James St, Liverpool, Managers.)

*Second class accommodation only, unless specially reserved.—Fares : Alexandria to Liverpool, 1st, £14 Single, £25 Return. 2nd, £9 Single, £15 Return.—To Malta, 1st, £5 Single, £9 Return, 2nd, £3 Single, £5 Return.—Return tickets available for six months.
S.S. Nitocais now on the berth, will sail on or about Saturday 1st inst, to be followed by S.S. Tabors.
S.S Tabor for Havre via Malta to sail about Saturday lst inst.
Through freight rates on cotton, etc., to Lancashire inland towns, Boston, New York and other U.S.A. towns, obtained on application. Cargo taken by special agreement only.
Passenger Tickets also issued inclusive of Railway fare through to and from Cairo. Particulars on application to
R. J. MOSS & Co., Alexandria, Agents.

div.head: P. HENDERSON & CO’s LINE.
div.p: Steamers leave SUEZ and PORT SAID fortnightly for LONDON or LIVERPOOL direct.
(Electric Light.) SALOON (Amidships) FARE £12. (Latest improvements.)
S.S. AMARAPOORA 5600 Tons will leave PORT SAID about March 4 for Liverpool.
S.S. MARTAHAN 7100 Tons will leave PORT SAID about March 20 for Liverpool.
S.S. BURMA 6660 Tons To follow for London
Due in LONDON or LIVERPOOL 12 days thereafter.
Apply WORMS & Co., Port Said and Suez. THOS. COOK & SON, (EGYPT) LD., CAIRO ;
G. J. GRACE & CO., ALEXANDRIA.

BRANCH OFFICE: OPPOSITE SAVOY HOTEL, CAIRO.
Alexandria, Port-Said, Ismailia, Suez, Luxor, Assuan, Haifa, & Khartum.
TOURIST AND GENERAL PASSENGER AGENTS. BANKERS.
BAGGAGE AND FORWARDING AGENTS.
NILE STEAMER SERVIVES.
TOURIST SERVICE,-The large and spendidly ap- pointed P.S. Rameses III will leave Cairo on Tuesday. February 28, for Luxor, Assouan, and Philae. Other sailings every Tuesday during the Season.
NEW SERVICE FROM ASSIOUT.-The first class tourist steamers "Amasis" and "Tewfik" will leave Assiout every Tuesday for Luxor, Assouan and Philae. 14 days on the Nile, including exoursions for £35
EXPRESS SERVICES.-Steamers leave Cairo every Monday and Friday during the season for Luxor, Assouan,and Philae. 20 days on the Nile for £22.
SPECIAL COMBINED RAILWAY ARE STEAMER NILE TOURS AT GREATLY REDUCED FARES.
BIWEEKLY SERVICE TO
SPECIAL STEAMERS ARE DAEABEAHS FOR PRIVATE PARTIES.
Regular Service of Fleight Steamers between CAIRO and HALFA.

Cook's Inserprefers in uniform are proceeds the principal Railway Stations and Landing-places is Europe no nerish passengers their slekens. Tours to Palestine, Syria and Dessert. Best camp equipment lowest charges. 10 12-904

div.head: British India S. N. Company, Limited.
div.p: MAIL AND PASSENGER STEAM SHIPS.
SAILINGS FROM SUEZ, LONDON and CALCUTTA LINE.
Calling at ADEN, COLOMBO and MADRAS Outward, and MARSEILLES (GENOA and PLYMOUTH optional) Homeward.
Fortnightly Service in connection with the Co's Indian Mail Lines and monthly with the East African Mail Line between ADEN, MOMBASSA and Zanzibar.
OUTWARD.—S.S. Goloonda ... March 4 | HOMEWARD.—S.S. Manora ... March 1
Queensland Line of Steamers Between London and Brisbane.
Calling at Colombo, Batavia, Cooktown, Townsville, and Rockhamptom.
The S.S. "CARPENTARIA will sail from Suez on or about the 25th March

REMARKS.-Surgeons and Stewardesses carried. Ice rooms, Punkahs, and every comfort for a tropical climate, Passengers and Cargo booked through the Continental and American Ports and to all important Ports on Coast of India, Persian Gulf, East Africa, Burmah, Straits Settlements, Eastern Archipelago, Java and Queensland Ports, Rates of Passage money, as below, include table for First and Second Class Passengers only, but not wines or spirits, which may be had on board for payment. Passengers are allowed to break the voyage at any intermediate Ports and proceed by following steamer in which there may be accommodation.
FIRST CLASS RATES OF PASSAGE MONEY FROM SUEZ AND ISMAILIA, TO
According is berihe occupied.
From Port-Said £2 less Homeward, and £2 more Outward. Second class, two thirds of 1st Class Fares.
Agents in LONDON, Messrs, Gray Dawes & Co., 33, Gt. Winchester St.
Managing Agents in INDIA, Messrs, MacKinnon, MacKensis & Co.,Calcuita, Bombay, and Kurraches.
Agents at PORT SAID, for the London, Calcutta and Persian Gulf Lines, Messrs. Worms & Co.
Agents at PORT SAID, for the London and Queensland Line, Messrs. Wills & Co., Limited.
Messrs. Thos. Cook & Son and the Anglo-American Hotel & Steamer Company, CAIRO & ALEXANDRIA.
For further particulars. Freight and Passage apply to G. BEYTS & Co. Agents, Suez. 31-12-905

div.head: ANCHOR LINE, Limited.
div.p: (HENDERSON BROTHERS,) LONDON, LIVERPOOL AND GLASGOW.
First class passenger steamers,
Booking Passengers and Cargo through to Ports in India, Europe & America
Sailing fortnightly from Suez.

Saloon Fares: from Port-Said, to Gibraltar £9; Marseilles £9: Liverpool (all sea route) £15; London (all sea route) £ 12 London via Marseilles £15.5.0. Passengers embarking at Iamailia £1 more, Suez £2 more, 10 % reduction for officers of army of Occupation and Government employés. Through tickets issued to New-York (via Glasgow). Fares on application.
Agents in Cairo, Messrs. Thos. Cook & Son. Port-Said, Messrs. Cory Brothers & Co., Ltd.
For further particulars of Freight or Passage apply to G. BEYTS & Co., Suez. 31-12-905

div.head: MARINE INSURANCE COMPANY, LIMITED.
div.p: Established 1836. Capital £1,000,000. Reserve Fund £650,000.
THE IMPERIAL FIRE OFFICE united with THE ALLIANCE ASSURANCE, Co., Ltd.
1, Old Broad Street, LONDON—Estabished 1806.—Total Funds exceed £10,000,000.
31-12-905. Policies issued at SUEZ by G. BEYTS & Co., Agents.

div.head: Deutsche Levante-Linie.
div.p: Mail and Passenger Steamships. Regular three-weekly Service from HAMBURG, via ANTWERP & MALTA, to ALEXANDRIA and vice-versa, admitting goods from all chief German Railway Stations on direct Bill of Landing to ALEXANDRIA and all chief ports of Egypt, Syria, etc., at favourable through rates of DEUTSCHE VERKEHR (traffic).
EXPECTED AT ALEXANDRIA.
S.S. Chios Feburary 27 from Antwerp bound for Beyrout.
S.S. Therapia March 3 from Hamburg.
S.S. Mezoa March 5 from Odessa bound for Rotterdam and Hamburg.
S.S. Krpros March 12from Odessa bound for Rotterdam and Hamburg.
For tariff and particulars apply to ADOLPHE STROSS, Alexandria, Agent.

div.head: ALEXANDRIA BONDED WAREHOUSE COMPANY, LTD.
div.p: (Société des Entrepôts d'Alexandrie)
Bonded Warehouses
IN ALEXANDRIA, CAIRO, PORT SAID, AND SUEZ.
Special Departments for clearing and forwarding and for a luggage and parcel Express Service.
Goods delivered against cash for account of shippers. 1-6-906

div.head: NATIONAL BANK OF EGYPT.
div.p: CAPITAL: L. 2,500,000. RESERVE (ENVIRON) : L. 700,000.
Gouverneur: Sir ELWIN PALMER, K.C.B., K.C.M.G.

Siège Social au Caire, Succursale à Alexandria, Agence à Assiout, Assuoan, Benha, Beni-Suef, Chibin el Kom, Damanhour, Fayoum, Khartoum, Kéneh, Mansourah. Minieh, Port-Said, Suakin, Sohag, Tantah, Zagazig, Mouski (Caire) et Londres (4 et 5, King William Street).

La National Bank of Egypt reçoit des dépots à termes fixes, fait des avances et ouvre des comptes courants sur titres, valeurs et marchandises. Elle s’occupe de l’achat et de la vente d'effets sur l’Etranger, de l'escompte, ainsi que de toutes opérations de Banque. 31-12-904

div.head: IMPERIAL OTTOMAN BANK.
div.p: HEAD OFFIOE IN CONSTANTINOPLE. CHIEF AGENCIES: LONDON & PARIS.
BRANCHES IN ALL THE PRINCIPAL TOWNS IN TURKEY.
Agencies in Egypt : ALEXANDRIA, CAIRO, & PORT SAID.

Advances on Merchandise and Securities in current account and for fixed periods. Purchase and sale of stocks and Shares on the London and Continental exchanges, letters of credit issued, valuables reoeived in safe custody. Drafts, cheques and telegraphic transfers issued on the principal towns of the world. Foreign exchange purchased, bills discounted, bills, invoices, annuities and dividends collected and every description of banking business transacted. 18-4-906

div.head: NEW KHEDIVIAL HOTEL, ALEXANDRIA.
div.p: First-class Hotel. Situated in Rosetta Avenue, the finest quarter in the Town. Two mintes from Railway Station. Close to Conservatory and the Opera House. Lift. Electric Light Throughout. Perfect Sanitary Arrangements. Magnificent Ball, Reception, Reading, and Music Rooms. Bar and Smoking Room.
HENRI CHAMOULLEAU, Proprietor.
FINE TERRACE ON THE AVENUE. - SPLENDID GARDEN. - OMNIBUS MEET ALL TRAINS AND STEAMERS. 28-26

div.head: PORT SAID-SAVOY HOTEL.
div.p: NEW FIRST-CLASS HOTEL, OVERLOOKING THE HARBOUR & OPPOSITE CUSTOM HOUSE
Open all the year round. — Well-appointed Bar.
MODERATE CHARGES. SPECIAL TERMS FOR RESIDENTS 1190A2-5

div.head: HOTEL BRISTOL. CAIRO.
div.p: Full South, Electric Light, opposite Esbekieh Gardens, Large Verandahs, Moderate Charges,
CHAS. BAUER, Proprietor.

The Hotel is beautifully fitted up and is in the most central part of Cairo. Terms for pension fare at the rate of ten shillings a day. Special terms for officers of Army of Occupation. 24,882-31-10-5

div.head: SUDAN GOVERNMENT RAILWAYS.
div.p: CAIRO-KHARTOUM WINTER MAIL SERVICE.
Mail delivered Cairo, Tues. and Saturday morn., and Khartoum, Mon. and Friday morn. *Dining and Sleeping Cars on Egyptian Railways.

div.head: INTERNATIONAL SLEEPING AND RESTAURANT CARS COMPANY.

row.cell: Restaurant Car runs every day between Cairo & Alexandria & vice-versa.

div.p: By the 10.15 p.m. train between Cairo and Alexandria and vice-versa a blanket and pillow can be obtained in a first class compartment on payment of a supplement 10 P.T.

row.cell: Daily Restaurant Car Service between Cairo, Ismailia, Port Said & vice-versa.
DAILY TRAIN IS LUXE,- Composed exclusively of Sleeping and Restaurant Cars..

div.p: Railway and Sleeping Car tickets can be obtained any number of days ahead at the office of the International Sleeping Car Company in Cairo and Luxor Station. 1st class Cairo-Luxor P.T. 200. Sleeping Car supplement P.T. 75.

div.head: Telephone Company of Egypt, Limited.
div.p: CAIRO-ALEXANDRIA TELEPHONE.--Rates as follows P.T. 5 for each 3 minutes, or fraction of 3 minutes; P.T. 10 for over 3 up to 8 minutes communication.

PUBLIC CALL-OFFICES : Cairo, Central Office, Opera Square, and New Bar; Helouan, Central Office, Maison Purvis ; Alexandria, St Mark’s Buildings, Egyptian Bar, I. Castelli & Co.; Ramleh, Central Office. San Stefano Casino 30.4.906

div.head: NORDDEUTSCHER LLOYD.
div.p: Welkly Service from ALEXANDRIA (Passenger and Freight) to NAPLES-MARSEILLES.
SCHLESWIG will leave ALEXANDRIA at 5 p.m. Feburary 22, March 8 & 22, April, 12 & 25 May 10 & 24 etc.
Hohensollernwill leave ALEXANDRIA at 5 p.m. March 1 & 15, April 5 & 12, May 5 & 17, & 24, etc.
The following steamers are intended to leave PORT-SAID:

row.cell: HOMEWARD : for Bremen Hamburg via Naples, Genoa, (Gibraltar), Southampton, Antwerp.
OUTWARD: for CHINA and JAPAN via SUEZ, ADEN, COLOMBO, PENANG, SINGAPORE.
For AUSTRALIA via SUEZ, ADEN, COLOMBO.

div.p: FOR FURTHER PARTICULARS APPLY TO THE AGENTS OF THE
NORDDEUTSCHER LLOYD at Cairo, Alexandria, Port-Said and Suez.
OTTO STERZING, Agent In Cairo, Opera Square.
C. H. SCHOELLER, Agent In Alexandria, Cleopatra Lane.

div.head: Austrian Lloyd’s Steam Navigation
div.p: Alexandria-Brindisi-Venice-Trieste Line.

Weekly Express Mail Service, Steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 4 p.m. arrive at Brindisi, Tuesday a.m. in time for express to Paris, London, Naples, Rome. Arrival Trieste Wednesday noon connecting with Vienna Express (Trieste-Ostende through carriage) and expresses to Italy and Germany.
Alexandria-Patras Brindisi-Trieste Line.
Steamer leaves Alexandria on or about March 1, March 15 and March 22.
Far East Line.

(Departures from Suez) To Aden, Bombay, Colombo, Penang, Singapore, Hong-Kong, Shanghai, Yokohama, Kobé about March 6 and April 4. To Aden, Karachi, and Bombay accelerated service about March 9 and March 18. To Aden, Karachi, Bombay, Colombo, Madras, Rangoon, and Calcutta about March 18. To Aden, Karschi, and Bombay aboutMarch 14.
East African Line.
To Aden, Mombassa, Zanzibar, Beira, Delagoa Bay, Durban, about March 6 and April 3.
Syrian-Caramanian Line
>Steamers leaves Alexandria on or about Feburary 20, March 6 and March 20.
Syrian-Cyprus-Caramanian Line.
Steamers leaves Alexandria on or about Feburary 27, March 18 and March 27.
For all information apply to the Company's Agents, Alexandria, Port Said and Suez, Thos. Cook & Son, Ld., Leon Heller, Cairo Agent, 4, Sharia Maghraby, (Telephone 192), Cairo; F. Tedeschi, Helouan.
Special passage rates granted to Egyptian Government officials, members of the Army of Occupation and their families.

div.head: SUDAN DEVELOPMENT & EXPLORATION COMPANY, LIMITED
div.p: KHARTOUM: CAIRO Office, Sharia Kasr-el-Nil.

TRANSPORT DEPARTMENT. Six days White Nile Tourist Trip dep. Khartoum Tuesdays. Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at all Cairo Tourist Agents. - Special Steamers for private charter. - Trips arranged and transport of goods undertaken to all places on White and Blue Niles within navigation limits.

ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT. Shipyard for construction of sternwheel steamers, barges, stream, motor launches, etc. Contractors for supply and erection of all classes of machinery, buildings, irrigation pumps, etc.
SOLE AGENTS FOR Dudbridges Oil Engines from 1 to 25 B.H.P. as supplied to Sudan Government. Seamless Steel Boat Co.. Ltd..etc..etc.
